Created attachment 32067
Only add boundary characters to the regex if it is not enclosed in parens

If a regex is given to match xml in recording controller, it will give back the matched string without the first and last boundary character.

More details can be found in
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/jmeter-user/201409.mbox/%3C6FF6E515E4DD154C89844BA1C2A5C0F102AB678F%40MM-EXCHANGE-002.cgpbooks.cgpgroup.local%3E

If we change the construction of the regex matcher, so that it will only add "\\b(" and ")\\b" to the regex if it doesn't start and ent with parens, then we can match xml.

Created attachment 32075
Add Documentation for new behaviour and correct documentation for old behaviour.

I have added a few paragraphs to describe the new functionality and corrected a few old examples, which would not have worked.

Another thing I think would be worth to implement is, that we could sort the user defined variables by length (longest first) before trying them out for replacement. That way a user could specify which replacement is most important to him.
